newsitem.title: UK: BSkyB confirms Chance to step down.
newsitem.headline: BSkyB confirms Chance to step down.

text.p: British Sky Broadcasting Plc said on Wednesday that deputy managing director David Chance would step down to a consultancy role at the end of the year.

"British Sky Broadcasting Group Plc confirms that David Chance will remain in his current role as deputy managing director until the end of 1997. David Chance will become a consultant to the group next year," the company said in a statement.
BSkyB announced on Tuesday that chief executive Sam Chisholm would step down from that position at the end of the year on medical advice.
Chance had been seen by many in the industry as his likely successor but the company said he had not applied for the job.
British media reports on Wednesday said that Chance had also been suffering health problems recently and that had prompted his decision to take a less demanding role.
